Wyll_Training.synopsis: Shadowheart and Wyll banter while journeying. Shadowheart mentions how Wyll's method of training the tiefling children in the grove is quite different to how she was trained herself.

Laezel_Underdark.synopsis: Shadowheart and Lae'zel rib each other passive-aggressively while journeying through the Underdark.

Minthara_LastLightCursed.synopsis: Banter between SH and Minthara in Last Light after it has fallen to the Shadow Curse (possibly as an indirect consequence of SH killing Nightsong, but possibly unrelated to this).

Karlach_MoonriseApproach.synopsis: Banter between SH and Karlach on the approach to Moonrise Towers.

Halsin_IllithidColony.synopsis: Banter between Shadowheart and Halsin in the illithid colony

Gale_AfterNight2.synopsis: (Triggers following Ceremorphosis2) Shadowheart and Gale converse while travelling. The topic turns to the previous night in camp, when they discussed their tadpole problem.

Astarion_Wyll.synopsis: While travelling, Shadowhearts asks if Astarion is nervous about travelling with a famed monster hunter. Wyll weighes in. (Astarion is known to be a vampire)

Astarion_Food.synopsis: Shadowheart and Astarion converse while travelling. Shadowheart daydreams about the food offerings in Baldur's Gate, while Astarion, not yet known to be a vampire, tries to engage.

Astarion_Swamp.synopsis: Shadowheart and Astarion banter while travelling through swamplands.

Halsin_SCLForest.synopsis: Banter between Shadowheart and Halsin in the Shadow-cursed lands.

Wyll_Spelling.synopsis: Shadowheart and Wyll converse as the travel. Shadowheart asks why Wyll spells his name as he does, leading to crossed wires.

Astarion_Darkness.synopsis: Shadowheart and Astarion banter while journeying through the Underdark. They have a mutual appreciation of the darkness, though for different reasons.

Laezel_PreFight.synopsis: Shadowheart and Lae'zel converse while travelling. Shadowheart's wary about travelling with a gith.

Halsin_MoonriseAssault.synopsis: Banter between SH and Halsin during the assault on Moonrise towers. (this will occur during a lull in the battle - guard is up but not in immediate danger)

Wyll_ROM_Act1.synopsis: Banter between SH and Wyll in Act 1.

Astarion_Philgraves.synopsis: Banter between SH and Astartion in Philgrave Mansion.

Minthara_ReithwinVillageOutdoors.synopsis: Banter betweem SH and Minthara in Reithwin village

Gale_Convert.synopsis: Shadowheart and Gale converse as they travel. Shadowheart enquires about Gale's apparent knowledge of ceremorphosis.

Astarion_Sweetheart.synopsis: Shadowheart and Astarion converse while journeying, Shadowheart asks if Astarion has anyone waiting for him.

Laezel_Gale_Creche.synopsis: Shadowheart, Lae'zel and Gale converse while travelling. Shadowheart asks what happens if Lae'zel hopes of being cured at a gith creche don't work out. Lae'zel doesn't even want to consider such an option. Gale chimes in, saying that Baldur's Gate will be their best chance - many skilled people are drawn there.

Astarion_SharTemple.synopsis: Banter between SH and Astarion in the Gauntlet of Shar.

Karlach_BlightedVillage.synopsis: Banter between SH and Karlach in the blighted village.

Laezel_ROM_Act2.synopsis: Banter between SH and Lae'zel in Act 2 when the player has romanced Lae'zel

Wyll_Legacy.synopsis: Shadowheart and Wyll converse as they travel. Shadowheart asks how Wyll feels about the irony of a monster hunter transforming into a monster himself.

Gale_ROM_Act2.synopsis: Banter between Shadowhear and Gale in Act 2

Laezel_Gith1.synopsis: Shadowheart and Lae'zel converse briefly while journeying. Shadowheart seems to be provoking Lae'zel. In reality she's also probing for information about the gith and their likely plans - she's recently engaged in a secret mission against them, and it stands to her to know her foe.

Halsin_ROM_Act3.synopsis: Banter between Shadowheart and Halsin in Act 3

Astarion_Moonrise.synopsis: Banter between SH and Astarion in Moonrise towers

Minthara_ROM_Act3.synopsis: Banter between SH and Minthara in Act 3

Wyll_BhaalTemple.synopsis: Banter between SH and Gale (not Wyll)

Astarion_CazadorsPalace.synopsis: Banter between SH and Astarion in Cazador's palace.

Laezel_MoonrisePrison.synopsis: Shadowheart and Lae'zel banter between themselves with in the Moonrise Towers prison

Laezel_Gith2.synopsis: Shadowheart and Lae'zel converse as they travel through the world. Shadowheart pries about Lae'zel's kind and the likelihood they'll come for her. She's fishing for information about the gith as she recently took part in a secret mission against them to steal a valuable artefact.

Wyll_MasonsGuild.synopsis: Banter between SH and Wyll in a masonry guild.

Laezel_Gith3.synopsis: Shadowheart and Lae'zel converse as they travel through the world. Shadowheart pries about Lae'zel's kind - specifically how they handle crime and punishment. She's fishing for information about the gith as she recently took part in a secret mission against them to steal a valuable artefact.

Halsin_Mausoleum.synopsis: Banter between Shadowheart and Halsin in the mausoleum of Ketheric Thorm

Astarion_ROM_Act1_PickUpArtist.synopsis: Banter between SH and Astarion in Act 1

Gale_Refugees.synopsis: (This banter can trigger after the player has entered the grove). Shadowheart and Gale converse while travelling. The topic turns to the refugees who are pouring through the general area in search of safety.

Astarion_Vampire.synopsis: Shadowheart and Astarion converse as they travel. Astarion is known to be a vampire and this has been accepted by the party. Shadowheart playfully asks him who he'd like to feed upon the most.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant.synopsis: Banter between SH and Astarion in Act 3

Gale_BlushingMermaid.synopsis: Banter between SH and Gale in a tavern in Baldur's Gate.

Astarion_CountingHouse.synopsis: Banter between SH and Astarion in the counting house (bank) of Baldur's Gate.

Laezel_ROM_Act3.synopsis: Banter between SH and Lae'zel in Act 3

Gale_ROM_Act1.synopsis: Banter between SH and Gale in Act 1.

Astarion_Battlefield.synopsis: Banter between SH and Astarion while crossing an ancient battlefield.

Karlach_RoadToSCL.synopsis: Banter between SH and Karlach on the road to SCL

Astarion_MountainPass.synopsis: Banter between Shadowheart and Astarion in the mountain pass region.

Laezel_Peace.synopsis: Shadowheart and Lae'zel converse while travelling. They've recently peacefully resolved a feud that developed between them, one that nearly turned violent,

Wyll_Fangirl.synopsis: Shadowheart and Wyll converse as they travel. Shadowheart asks Wyll about his toughest kill. She plays it cool but is eager to her how he defeated a minotaur. Wyll obliges with a retelling.

Karlach_Grymforge.synopsis: Banter between SH and Karlach in Grymforge

Karlach_Monastery.synopsis: Banter between SH and Karlach in creche monastery

Minthara_ROM_Act2.synopsis: Banter between Shadowheart and Minthara in Act 2

Astarion_Tollhouse_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Tollhouse_0.text: I have to ask, Astarion. Do people taste different from one another, when you feed?

Astarion_Tollhouse_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Tollhouse_3.text: It all depends. A clean neck certainly helps.

Astarion_Tollhouse_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Tollhouse_1.text: Come on, you know I'm talking about their blood.

Astarion_Tollhouse_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Tollhouse_2.text: Of course, there are different vintages. Young noble is wonderful if you can get it, but crone has its charms too.

Wyll_Training_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_Training_1.text: I saw you training those children. You were so gentle! That's... not how I was taught.
Wyll_Training_1.context: NodeContext: A little resentment that she didn't have an empathic teacher like Wyll when she was growing up.

Wyll_Training_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Training_3.text: Cruel words strengthen neither heads nor hearts, Shadowheart.

Wyll_Training_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_Training_2.text: I wouldn't quite say that - I learned the lesson, after all.
Wyll_Training_2.context: NodeContext: Defensive - 'I turned out all right'

Wyll_Training_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Training_0.text: And came to resent your tutor, I bet. I taught them to fight - not to hate.

Laezel_Underdark_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Laezel_Underdark_0.text: Careful Lae'zel, it's dark around here. Would be a terrible shame to lose you forever.

Laezel_Underdark_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Underdark_1.text: Yes, do keep your wits, Shadowheart. Should a dagger suddenly slice your neck, we may never know who's to blame.

Minthara_LastLightCursed_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Minthara_LastLightCursed_1.text: Gone. Swallowed up by the shadow curse.
Minthara_LastLightCursed_1.context: NodeContext: Taken aback at the sight of a former hub, now consumed by the Shadow curse. Can be applicable to either arc - gut reaction.

Minthara_LastLightCursed_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_LastLightCursed_0.text: Not before time. They hoped to stand against Ketheric with little more than a trick of the light to protect them.
Minthara_LastLightCursed_0.context: NodeContext: Scornful -reflecting on the death of people within the shadow curse

Minthara_LastLightCursed_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Minthara_LastLightCursed_2.text: Worse - they defied Lady Shar's power, openly. Now they have paid the price.
Minthara_LastLightCursed_2.context: NodeContext: Bullish. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

Minthara_LastLightCursed_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Minthara_LastLightCursed_3.text: They were desperate. Nobody deserves this.
Minthara_LastLightCursed_3.context: NodeContext: Haunted. Arc: SH has turned from Shar.

Gale_MorphicPool_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_MorphicPool_1.text: The end must be near. No regrets, Gale? You may have been better off staying inside that boulder...

Gale_MorphicPool_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_MorphicPool_2.text: Unlikely. Had I stayed there much longer, the orb would have reduced it to rubble. Besides, think of all the fun I'd have missed out on.

Gale_MorphicPool_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_MorphicPool_0.text: Fun? Well... yes. I suppose we did manage to make the best of things.

Wyll_AbandonedCistern_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_AbandonedCistern_0.text: You know what would be nice, just for a change? Venturing through a mysterious bazaar, or a lush, dark wood, scented with lavender.
Wyll_AbandonedCistern_0.context: NodeContext: Politely complaining. 'sun-dappled vineyard...' = SH has turned from Shar. 'a mysterious bazaar..' = SH is loyal to Shar.

Wyll_AbandonedCistern_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_AbandonedCistern_2.text: Not so fond of the sewers, then?

Wyll_AbandonedCistern_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_AbandonedCistern_1.text: They have their purpose. I'd just rather we didn't have to wade through their purpose.
Wyll_AbandonedCistern_1.context: NodeContext: rueful. Applicable to either SH arc

Karlach_MoonriseApproach_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Karlach_MoonriseApproach_0.text: Moonrise Towers. There used to be more than one tower, of course. The other must have been destroyed.

Karlach_MoonriseApproach_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_MoonriseApproach_2.text: I figured as much, what with my one good eye for seeing and fingers for counting.

Karlach_MoonriseApproach_1.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_MoonriseApproach_1.text: ... sorry, no need for that. Must've put too much salt on my blood sausage this morning.

Karlach_MoonriseApproach_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Karlach_MoonriseApproach_3.text: Not at all. Nice to be on the receiving end, now and again. Keeps me sharp.

Karlach_MoonriseApproach_5.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_MoonriseApproach_5.text: I figured as much, being the proud owner of eyes.

Halsin_IllithidColony_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Halsin_IllithidColony_0.text: This place is like some moist, unappealing maze. Can your nose guide us, Halsin?

Halsin_IllithidColony_2.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_IllithidColony_2.text: I fear not. The vapours in this alien cloaca are most bizarre.

Halsin_IllithidColony_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Halsin_IllithidColony_1.text: Cloaca...? You could have just said tunnels, you know. I'm nauseous enough as it is.

Minsc_Intro2_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Minsc_Intro2_0.text: | Hey Minsc, How do you judge what's evil? |

Minsc_Intro2_2.speaker: Minsc
Minsc_Intro2_2.text: | Enough trick questions! Evil is clearly evil. |

Minsc_Intro2_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Minsc_Intro2_1.text: | Am I evil? You called my goddess so. |

Minsc_Intro2_3.speaker: Minsc
Minsc_Intro2_3.text: | If I decide you are evil, my blade will inform you of the fact. |

Gale_AfterNight2_3.speaker: Gale
Gale_AfterNight2_3.text: No signs of tentacles so far.

Gale_AfterNight2_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_AfterNight2_0.text: The same... except for a knot of worry in my stomach that's in no rush to go away.

Astarion_Wyll_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Wyll_1.text: So. A vampire spawn and a monster hunter in the same group. We're not going to have trouble, are we?

Astarion_Wyll_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Wyll_0.text: Excuse me? Since this tadpole, I'm barely a monster at all.

Astarion_Wyll_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Wyll_2.text: I just want to survive, same as you.

Astarion_Wyll_3.speaker: Wyll
Astarion_Wyll_3.text: I don't see a problem, as long as mister fang there keeps his appetite in check.

Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_4.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_4.text: Hey, Shaddy, got a quick question about the best way to treat an infernal burn.

Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_1.context: NodeContext: reacting to Karlach trying out nicknames for her. Applicable to either arc

Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_2.text: Hearty? Shadsy? Or maybe just The Fringe?

Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_3.text: 'Shadowheart' will do just fine, thanks. Love is making you fanciful.
Karlach_ROM_Act2_001_3.context: NodeContext: reacting to Karlach trying out nicknames for her. Applicable to either arc

Astarion_Food_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Food_2.text: You know what I really miss about Baldur's Gate? The food. Freshest fish I've ever had.

Astarion_Food_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Food_0.text: I don't care for fish. Red meat - now that's a different matter. Rare as can be... dripping.

Astarion_Food_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Food_1.text: Well unless we find a cure you won't have any teeth to chew it with soon enough.

Astarion_Swamp_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Swamp_0.text: Ugh, I hate swamps. The place reeks - probably full of bloodsuckers as well.

Astarion_Swamp_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Swamp_2.text: I can't blame them. You're delicious.

Astarion_Swamp_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Swamp_1.text: If that was an attempt at flirting, I should let you know I prefer the strong, silent type.

Astarion_Swamp_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Swamp_3.context: NodeContext: Responding to 'swamp's probably full of bloodsuckers'

Astarion_Swamp_4.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Swamp_4.context: NodeContext: Shadowhearts that the swamp's probably full of bloodsuckers. She doesn't know you're a vampire.

Halsin_SCLForest_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Halsin_SCLForest_0.text: Chin up, Halsin. I know you don't favour Lady Shar's darkness, but look - trees!
Halsin_SCLForest_0.context: NodeContext: Poking fun at Halsin. Arc: Shadowheart is dedicated to Shar (and in this moment, enjoys resistance to a shadow curse that saps the strength of her companions)

Halsin_SCLForest_3.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_SCLForest_3.text: I will not be taunted in this place - not after all it has taken from me. Show respect, or you will force my hand.

Halsin_SCLForest_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Halsin_SCLForest_1.text: Is that so? It's quite a hand...
Halsin_SCLForest_1.context: NodeContext: Knowing/playful. Arc: Shadowheart is dedicated to Shar (and in this moment, enjoys resistance to a shadow curse that saps the strength of her companions)

Halsin_SCLForest_5.speaker: Shadowheart
Halsin_SCLForest_5.text: Halsin... were there ever wolves in these woods?
Halsin_SCLForest_5.context: NodeContext: trying to sound casual, but thinking about her past, in which Sharrans kidnapped her while a wolf was pursuing. Arc: SH has turned from Shar.

Halsin_SCLForest_4.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_SCLForest_4.text: Once, certainly. But not for a hundred years. Any that still prowl this land can scarcely be called wolves any longer.

Halsin_SCLForest_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Halsin_SCLForest_2.text: I see... a hundred years is too far back, for what I had in mind. No matter.
Halsin_SCLForest_2.context: NodeContext: A little disappointed. Perhaps wondering if she might have had a connection to the regjon, once. Arc: SH has turned from Shar.

Wyll_Spelling_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Spelling_3.text: Why 'y'? A great-uncle's name, my father said. But I just figured he couldn't spell.

Astarion_Darkness_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Darkness_0.text: Such depth to the shadows... I don't care what others say about the Underdark - it's beautiful down here.

Astarion_Darkness_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Darkness_1.text: I'm used to a crypt's gloom. This is something else.
Astarion_Darkness_1.context: NodeContext: Admiring the surreal beauty of the underdark

Astarion_Darkness_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Darkness_2.text: I've spent long enough in the dark. It gets old.
Astarion_Darkness_2.context: NodeContext: He'd rather be in the sun.

Laezel_PreFight_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Laezel_PreFight_1.text: I'll be keeping an eye on you, understand?

Laezel_PreFight_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_PreFight_0.text: If I choose to kill you, you will not even see it.

Halsin_MoonriseAssault_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Halsin_MoonriseAssault_0.text: Odd that you're fighting Ketheric Thorm again, only this time with a warrior of Lady Shar at your side.
Halsin_MoonriseAssault_0.context: NodeContext: Amused/ironic. Arc: Shadowheart is loyal to Shar. She has been tasked with killing Ketheric Thorm, an onetime Shar worshipper.

Halsin_MoonriseAssault_2.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_MoonriseAssault_2.text: They say that history does not repeat, but it does rhyme, now and again. This is a rather unharmonious example.

Halsin_MoonriseAssault_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Halsin_MoonriseAssault_1.text: Indeed. 'Shadowheart and Halsin, Sharran and Bear. Who would have dreamt of an alliance so rare'.
Halsin_MoonriseAssault_1.context: NodeContext: Playful. Improvising a shitty rhyme.  Arc: Shadowheart is loyal to Shar. She has been tasked with killing Ketheric Thorm, an onetime Shar worshipper.

Halsin_MoonriseAssault_5.speaker: Shadowheart
Halsin_MoonriseAssault_5.text: Second time's a charm, eh, Halsin? Let's make sure Ketheric Thorm is gone for good this time.
Halsin_MoonriseAssault_5.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart has turned  from Shar.

Halsin_MoonriseAssault_3.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_MoonriseAssault_3.text: Indeed. Though I wondered if you might have some empathy for him... both being former disciples of Shar.

Halsin_MoonriseAssault_4.speaker: Shadowheart
Halsin_MoonriseAssault_4.text: Hardly - he's merely one more obstacle - and a killable one, now that Nightsong is free.
Halsin_MoonriseAssault_4.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart has turned  from Shar.

Wyll_Tabernacle_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_Tabernacle_0.text: A gallows? Nooses are for amateurs - that's what I was taught in the Grotto. Do you know how badly those things can go wrong?
Wyll_Tabernacle_0.context: NodeContext: Scornful. Can be applied to either of SH's arcs

Wyll_Tabernacle_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Tabernacle_3.text: I'd rather not think of it, Shadowheart...

Wyll_Tabernacle_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_Tabernacle_1.text: You could strangle them by accident, use too much rope and break their legs... and if it goes really badly, you could wrench their heads right off.
Wyll_Tabernacle_1.context: NodeContext: 'oh, she's done her research' . Can be applied to either of SH's arcs

Wyll_Tabernacle_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Tabernacle_2.text: What a picture you pain. Quite detailed, quite colourful. Quite unnecessary.

Wyll_ROM_Act1_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_ROM_Act1_3.text: Someone of your... social stature, Wyll. Are they typically allowed to pursue their heart's whims as they like?
Wyll_ROM_Act1_3.context: NodeContext: Curious. Alluding to Wyll being in a romance with the player when he comes from an aristocratic background.

Wyll_ROM_Act1_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act1_0.text: I don't have to ask for permission, if that's what you mean.

Wyll_ROM_Act1_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_ROM_Act1_2.text: Really? I'm surprised. I thought dowries, alliances and old blueblood feuds might have to be balanced against your desires.
Wyll_ROM_Act1_2.context: NodeContext: Curious. Alluding to Wyll being in a romance with the player when he comes from an aristocratic background.

Wyll_ROM_Act1_1.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act1_1.text: I'm my own man, Shadowheart... in this sense, at least.

Astarion_Philgraves_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Philgraves_0.text: A distinct whiff of undeath to this place... though curious, I can't say I've ever noticed the same about you, Astarion.

Astarion_Philgraves_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Philgraves_3.text: My 'whiff' is very faint, thank you - nothing a little bergamot, rosemary, and a hint of aged brandy can't hide.

Astarion_Philgraves_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Philgraves_1.text: It's the perfect olfactory disguise for a corpse. Honestly, I missed my calling as a perfumer.

Astarion_Philgraves_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Philgraves_2.text: You've clearly thought this through a great deal. I'm impressed and appalled in equal measure.

Minthara_ReithwinVillageOutdoors_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Minthara_ReithwinVillageOutdoors_3.text: This place was ruined rather thoroughly. I'm starting to forget what a habitable village looks like.

Minthara_ReithwinVillageOutdoors_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ReithwinVillageOutdoors_1.text: Your Sharran kin are responsible for this ruin. They purged these lands even before the shadow curse, and pillaged all they could find.

Minthara_ReithwinVillageOutdoors_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Minthara_ReithwinVillageOutdoors_0.text: No... this must have been due to the battle. Lady Shar's warriors would have little interet in looting...
Minthara_ReithwinVillageOutdoors_0.context: NodeContext: A little disbelieving. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

Minthara_ReithwinVillageOutdoors_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ReithwinVillageOutdoors_2.text: Come, Shadowheart. Do you think prayers alone can keep an army on the march?

Minthara_ReithwinVillageOutdoors_5.speaker: Shadowheart
Minthara_ReithwinVillageOutdoors_5.text: Even those devoted to loss fill their pockets and bellies when the chance arises.

Minthara_ReithwinVillageOutdoors_4.speaker: Shadowheart
Minthara_ReithwinVillageOutdoors_4.text: Not my kin - not any longer. Their past deeds are not my responsibility.
Minthara_ReithwinVillageOutdoors_4.context: NodeContext: rejecting any implicit complicity. Arc: SH has turned from Shar.

Gale_Convert_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_Convert_0.text: You seem to know a good deal about our condition, Gale.

Gale_Convert_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_Convert_1.text: Everything, really - not to put too fine a point on it.

Astarion_Sweetheart_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Sweetheart_0.text: Do you have someone waiting for you in Baldur's Gate, Astarion? A sweetheart perhaps?

Astarion_Sweetheart_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Sweetheart_1.text: No sweethearts, no. I prefer them savoury.

Astarion_Sweetheart_4.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Sweetheart_4.text: This is what I get for trying to strike up conversation.

Astarion_Sweetheart_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Sweetheart_3.text: Not one in particular. The city is a veritable feast of sweethearts.

Astarion_Sweetheart_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Sweetheart_2.text: You must be eager to get back then. Slimmer pickings out in this wilderness.

Laezel_Gale_Creche_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Laezel_Gale_Creche_1.text: What if this crèche doesn't work out, Lae'zel? What if your kin fail you?

Laezel_Gale_Creche_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Gale_Creche_3.text: If I can reach the crèche, my kin will provide - any failure will be mine alone.

Laezel_Gale_Creche_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Laezel_Gale_Creche_2.text: If you say so. Just don't expect me to put all my eggs in the same basket.

Laezel_Gale_Creche_0.speaker: Gale
Laezel_Gale_Creche_0.text: That expression must sound curious to a githyanki ear, given the way they're birthed.

Minsc_Intro1_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Minsc_Intro1_3.text: | Hey Minsc, what was it like, being a statue? |

Minsc_Intro1_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Minsc_Intro1_1.text: | The dark is Shar's domain. You wouldn't have been lonely if you embraced her. |

Laezel_ROM_Act1_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Laezel_ROM_Act1_0.text: I wouldn't have predicted the night you shared with our friend, Lae'zel. You didn't consider it beneath you?
Laezel_ROM_Act1_0.context: NodeContext: Teasiing Lae'zel for being in a romance with the player. Early game/SH is loyal to Shar

Laezel_ROM_Act1_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act1_1.text: They were beneath me, at times. But also above me, And standing, at certain points.

Laezel_ROM_Act1_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Laezel_ROM_Act1_2.text: That's enough, I get the picture. Gods, do I get the picture...
Laezel_ROM_Act1_2.context: NodeContext: 'Too much information, thanks' Early game/SH is loyal to Shar

Wyll_WyrmSouth_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_WyrmSouth_0.text: You know, I'm starting to remember that Wyrm's Crossing has a bit of a reputation, doesn't it? A tad mercenary, a tad sordid. Anything and anyone for a price...
Wyll_WyrmSouth_0.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful - not necessarily critical of the place she's referring to. Can be applicable to either of SH's arcs

Wyll_WyrmSouth_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_WyrmSouth_2.text: Ah, but to little harm. Shouldn't we all be allowed to stoke a few fires from time to time?

Wyll_WyrmSouth_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_WyrmSouth_1.text: You sound like you're speaking from experience, Wyll. Perhaps you'll have to give me a tour - refresh my memory.
Wyll_WyrmSouth_1.context: NodeContext: Playful.  Can be applicable to either of SH's arcs

Wyll_WyrmSouth_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_WyrmSouth_3.text: Heh - I'm afraid you'd find my own stories rather tight-laced, Shadowheart. I was never one to sow my wild oats.

Wyll_MoonriseEpilogue_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_MoonriseEpilogue_0.text: Sobering, to think that we've got even tougher battles yet to come.

Wyll_MoonriseEpilogue_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_MoonriseEpilogue_2.text: We've chipped away a piece of the Absolute. It will take all our might, all our will, to fully shatter it.

Wyll_MoonriseEpilogue_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_MoonriseEpilogue_1.text: I'm not despairing. Far from it. I just hope we're afforded a little breathing room before the  next onslaught.

Astarion_SharTemple_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_SharTemple_0.text: You're uncharacteristically quiet, Astarion. Awed into silence?

Astarion_SharTemple_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_SharTemple_3.text: Awed? By this? Please - size isn't everything. At least when it comes to temples.

Astarion_SharTemple_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_SharTemple_2.text: Well what would impress you, then?

Astarion_SharTemple_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_SharTemple_1.text: Oh, I don't know, but a little more colour wouldn't hurt. All the black and purple just makes me think of bruises...

Karlach_BlightedVillage_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Karlach_BlightedVillage_0.text: The whole village is falling to pieces. These goblins aren't exactly house-proud, as occupiers go...
Karlach_BlightedVillage_0.context: NodeContext: Tut-tut. Early game. SH is still loyal to Shar.

Karlach_BlightedVillage_4.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_BlightedVillage_4.text: Wouldn't blame the gobs. Place looks like it's been abandoned a good while.

Karlach_BlightedVillage_1.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_BlightedVillage_1.text: But hey, maybe we can scare up a few dusty bottles of wine somewheres.

Karlach_BlightedVillage_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Karlach_BlightedVillage_3.text: I like your way of thinking. Split any takings we find?
Karlach_BlightedVillage_3.context: NodeContext: Appreciative of Karlach's optimism. Early game. SH is still loyal to Shar.

Karlach_BlightedVillage_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_BlightedVillage_2.context: NodeContext: Just agreed to split alcohol with Shadowheart

Laezel_ROM_Act2_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Laezel_ROM_Act2_1.text: I'm a tad surprised you change into more comfortable garb at camp, Lae'zel. You strike me as a 'sleeps in her armour' type.
Laezel_ROM_Act2_1.context: NodeContext: Idle banter with Lae'zel. Applicable to either SH arc

Laezel_ROM_Act2_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act2_2.text: It would cause too much noise during my nighttime... exertions. I do not wish to alert foes of our location.

Laezel_ROM_Act2_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Laezel_ROM_Act2_0.text: Nighttime exertions...? Oh, I see. Well, considerate of you, I suppose.
Laezel_ROM_Act2_0.context: NodeContext: realisation/slightly flustered (Lae'zel is in a romance with the player) Applicable to either SH arc

Wyll_Legacy_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_Legacy_0.text: Have you wondered what people will say, Wyll? When they find out the monster hunter is becoming a monster.

Wyll_Legacy_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Legacy_2.text: I've faced countless perils and conquered them all. This will be no different.

Wyll_Legacy_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_Legacy_1.text: I've always had a soft spot for the confident ones...

Gale_ROM_Act2_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act2_1.text: When you've loved a goddess - as I have - people often think you less experienced in the ways of romance.
Gale_ROM_Act2_1.context: NodeContext: A bit 'woe is me', feeling the need to defend himself

Gale_ROM_Act2_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act2_2.text: It's true, for a time I neglected the physical in favour of celestial euphoria. But our relationship was no less real for it.
Gale_ROM_Act2_2.context: NodeContext: A bit 'woe is me', feeling the need to defend himself

Gale_ROM_Act2_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_ROM_Act2_0.context: NodeContext: Joke-quoting Gale when he's being defensive aboiut his love life.

Gale_ROM_Act2_4.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_ROM_Act2_4.text: Only jesting. I know all too well what it's like to pine after a goddess...
Gale_ROM_Act2_4.context: NodeContext: 'to pine after a goddess' = SH loyal to Shar. 'I'm in no position to judge' = SH turned from Shar

Gale_ROM_Act2_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_ROM_Act2_3.text: Only jesting. I'm sure you're a force to be reckoned with.
Gale_ROM_Act2_3.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH is loyal to Shar (shar worship still a secret)

Laezel_Gith1_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Laezel_Gith1_0.text: So, gith. Aren't you worried your kind will punish you for consorting with us?

Laezel_Gith1_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Gith1_1.context:
NodeContext: K'chakhi = 'idiot' in gith. Pronounced ke-CHOCK-ee.
Lae'zel = character name. Pronounced Lay-zel

Laezel_Gith1_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Gith1_2.text: And my kin will understand my need for servants. They will help you, but only if I ask.

Halsin_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Halsin_ROM_Act3_2.text: Halsin, if I were a druid, what animal do you think I'd be?
Halsin_ROM_Act3_2.context: NodeContext: Idle banter. Can be applicable to either Shadowheart arc

Halsin_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_ROM_Act3_0.text: Given your memory issues, perhaps a goldfish?

Halsin_ROM_Act3_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Halsin_ROM_Act3_3.text: I'd hoped for something a bit more exotic... but would you carry around my fish bowl, feed me flakes of food?
Halsin_ROM_Act3_3.context: NodeContext: Idle banter. Can be applicable to either Shadowheart arc

Astarion_Moonrise_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Moonrise_0.text: This must have been quite a place, in its heyday. Could you ever picture yourself living here, Astarion? You know, assuming the riff-raff were cleared out?

Astarion_Moonrise_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Moonrise_2.text: Tempting, but it's not really for me.

Astarion_Moonrise_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Moonrise_1.text: Really? Even with all these chambers, and the commanding views? You could live like a lord.

Astarion_Moonrise_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Moonrise_3.text: But I'd have to climb so many stairs. Anyway, I already have my eye on a palace in Baldur's Gate.
Astarion_Moonrise_3.context: NodeContext: 'palace in baldur's gate' = Cazador's palace

Minthara_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Minthara_ROM_Act3_1.text: Is drow society as the books say? It almost sounds tempting - matriarchal power, flourishing to its greatest extent.
Minthara_ROM_Act3_1.context: NodeContext: Curious. Idle banter. Can be applicable to either of Shadowheart's arcs

Minthara_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ROM_Act3_0.text: It flourishes because the strong feed on the weak. Charming as you are, child, you would be nourishment for the matrons mothers.

Minthara_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Minthara_ROM_Act3_2.context: NodeContext: Slightly taken aback/not going there. Idle banter. Can be applicable to either of Shadowheart's arcs

Wyll_BhaalTemple_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_BhaalTemple_0.text: Why must the Dead Three be so obvious and ugly with their decor? Blood and bones. Bones and blood. Pointy nonsense. Now Lady Shar - she has panache.
Wyll_BhaalTemple_0.context: NodeContext: bemoaning the aesthetics of a triumverate of evil gods. 'At least Shar had some panache.' = SH left Shar. 'Now Lady Shar - she has panache.' = SH loyal to shar

Wyll_BhaalTemple_3.speaker: Gale
Wyll_BhaalTemple_3.text: As did Mystra's home on Elysium. Her ribbed vaults and buttresses created a magic entirely of their own. Not to mention her pleasure domes...
Wyll_BhaalTemple_3.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic in remembering the architecture of Mystra's home, ignorant of the innuendo

Wyll_BhaalTemple_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_BhaalTemple_1.context: NodeContext: Snort of laughter, Induging in juvenile humour briefly. Applicable to either SH arc

Wyll_BhaalTemple_2.speaker: Gale
Wyll_BhaalTemple_2.text: It's a perfectly legitimate architectural feature!

Wyll_WaterQueen_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_WaterQueen_0.text: Umberlee - a brutal goddess, from what I understand. Without even the slightest touch of subtlety to her.

Wyll_WaterQueen_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_WaterQueen_3.text: Subtlety isn't exactly your forte, given how you've strolled about wearing a circlet inset with Shar's symbol.

Wyll_WaterQueen_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_WaterQueen_1.text: That's different. You'd be surprised how easily Lady Shar can hide in plain sight. People go around blinkered, caught up in their own lives.
Wyll_WaterQueen_1.context: NodeContext: proselytising,  Arc - SH is loyal to shar

Wyll_WaterQueen_4.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_WaterQueen_4.context: NodeContext: Conceding she just likes the look after justifying it on religious grounds

Wyll_WaterQueen_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_WaterQueen_2.text: You'd be surprised how people can miss what's in plain sight. I missed the fact that Shar was deceiving me. Besides, I have a new look now. Suits me, I think.
Wyll_WaterQueen_2.context: NodeContext: Some regret, before shaking it off. Arc - SH has turned from Shar

Wyll_WaterQueen_5.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_WaterQueen_5.text: On that matter, you'll hear no argument from me.

Astarion_CazadorsPalace_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_CazadorsPalace_0.text: So, Astarion. Vampire dens - what should I expect?

Astarion_CazadorsPalace_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_CazadorsPalace_3.text: Vampires would be a safe bet.

Astarion_CazadorsPalace_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_CazadorsPalace_1.text: Hilarious. You belong on stage - perhaps the bloodstained sort, with a hooded man standing by, axe in hand.

Astarion_CazadorsPalace_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_CazadorsPalace_2.text: So long as there's a cheering crowd. As for vampire dens, I'd brace your nose. They can be very... organic.

Laezel_MoonrisePrison_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Laezel_MoonrisePrison_0.text: All those locked cells. A girl could cause all sorts of mischief with skilled fingers and a hairpin...

Laezel_MoonrisePrison_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_MoonrisePrison_2.text: You have done mischief enough with hairpins, if your tresses are an indication. The prisoners would be a hindrance.

Laezel_MoonrisePrison_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Laezel_MoonrisePrison_1.text: A hindrance, you say? Remind me, where did we fetch you from again? Oh that's right - a cage, caught by a couple of tieflings. Interesting.

Laezel_MoonrisePrison_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Laezel_MoonrisePrison_3.text: I'd rather an extra burden than extra enemies. Anyone the Absolute has captive is one tadpole away from taking up arms against us.

Laezel_Gith2_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Laezel_Gith2_1.text: Do you think your kin search for you, Lae'zel?

Laezel_Gith2_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Gith2_0.text: I know they do not. It is my responsibility to cleanse myself.

Laezel_Gith2_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Laezel_Gith2_2.text: They pursued the nautiloid. Perhaps they were trying to free you.

Laezel_Gith2_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Gith2_3.text: A vain notion. I am one of many and will not be a burden to my Queen.

Minthara_TadpolingCenter_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Minthara_TadpolingCenter_3.text: Ugh. This place brings back unwelcome memories of a tadpole slipping behind my eye...
Minthara_TadpolingCenter_3.context: NodeContext: Distaste (in a place where people are infected with tadpoles)

Minthara_TadpolingCenter_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_TadpolingCenter_0.text: Appalling. I am glad my memories of the infection are not so clear.
Minthara_TadpolingCenter_0.context: NodeContext: with a shudder, having heard a description of illithid infection

Minthara_TadpolingCenter_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Minthara_TadpolingCenter_2.text: Oh yes, I forgot - you had your love of the Absolute to mask the ugly parts.
Minthara_TadpolingCenter_2.context: NodeContext: Veiled criticism of a former enemy

Minthara_TadpolingCenter_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_TadpolingCenter_1.text: Do not call it love. It was poison.
Minthara_TadpolingCenter_1.context: NodeContext: quietly angry. Heavy emphasis on poison.

Wyll_MasonsGuild_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_MasonsGuild_0.text: All this stonework has me thinking - would you ever want a statue of yourself, Wyll?

Wyll_MasonsGuild_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_MasonsGuild_2.text: It seems a rather... vain notion to me. But I can't say I haven't thought about it. How about you?

Wyll_MasonsGuild_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_MasonsGuild_1.text: I suppose it might be nice to be remembered - though I'd be less keen on having birds perching on my head for evermore.

Wyll_MasonsGuild_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_MasonsGuild_3.text: Think of the... er... mess they'd make. Well - better your statue's head than your own.

Gale_LastLightShrine_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_LastLightShrine_1.text: Imagine being compelled to hide a shrine in a land that is actively hostile to you and your goddess. Utter pigheadedness.
Gale_LastLightShrine_1.context: NodeContext: Disdain, Referring to a shrine of Selune. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

Gale_LastLightShrine_5.speaker: Gale
Gale_LastLightShrine_5.text: Tenacity might be a kinder word for it.

Gale_LastLightShrine_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_LastLightShrine_3.text: I'll leave the kinder words to the softer hearts.
Gale_LastLightShrine_3.context: NodeContext: Disdain, Referring to a shrine of Selune. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

Gale_LastLightShrine_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_LastLightShrine_2.text: A Selûnite shrine. It would've made my blood boil, once, just to look upon this...
Gale_LastLightShrine_2.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful/conflicted. On seeing a hidden Selune shrine. Arc: SH has rejected Shar.

Gale_LastLightShrine_4.speaker: Gale
Gale_LastLightShrine_4.text: You are lucky to have left that anger behind.

Gale_LastLightShrine_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_LastLightShrine_0.text: I don't know... the anger was simple. I understood it, found comfort in it. Now I don't know what to believe.
Gale_LastLightShrine_0.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful/conflicted. On seeing a hidden Selune shrine. Arc: SH has rejected Shar.

Laezel_Gith3_4.speaker: Shadowheart
Laezel_Gith3_4.text: Lae'zel, how would you punish someone who wronged you?

Laezel_Gith3_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Gith3_3.text: Killing is good - it culls the weak. But theft would be paid for painfully, a thousand times over.

Halsin_Mausoleum_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Halsin_Mausoleum_0.text: So this is where you interred Ketheric Thorm, Halsin? Couldn't you have done a little more to prevent his return...?

Halsin_Mausoleum_2.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_Mausoleum_2.text: We did the best we could, under dire circumstances. You would suggest otherwise?

Halsin_Mausoleum_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Halsin_Mausoleum_1.text: All I'm saying is that it's more difficult to come back from the dead if you were chopped up and had the pieces delivered to different corners of the realm.

Astarion_ROM_Act1_PickUpArtist_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_ROM_Act1_PickUpArtist_0.text: I can't quite believe you've been a pick-up artist all these years, Astarion.
Astarion_ROM_Act1_PickUpArtist_0.context: NodeContext: Poking fun/banter. Referring to Astarion's romance with the player. Early game/SH is loyal to Shar

Astarion_ROM_Act1_PickUpArtist_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_ROM_Act1_PickUpArtist_3.text: Most of the things you say still sound like you're in a two-copper paperback read by little girls.
Astarion_ROM_Act1_PickUpArtist_3.context: NodeContext: Poking fun/banter. Referring to Astarion's romance with the player. Early game/SH is loyal to Shar

Astarion_ROM_Act1_PickUpArtist_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act1_PickUpArtist_1.text: I sound like a charming rake, you mean? The hero everyone fawns over?

Gale_Refugees_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_Refugees_1.text: The road to Baldur's Gate is a long one. Who knows how long it'll take these folks to get there on foot?

Gale_Refugees_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_Refugees_0.text: If they make it. They're slow, vulnerable. Half or more will die long before Basilisk Gate.

Gale_Refugees_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_Refugees_2.text: Doesn't seem to trouble you a jot.

Gale_Refugees_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_Refugees_3.text: What good would it do for me to be troubled? We can't save them all.

Astarion_Vampire_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Vampire_0.text: So, Astarion. Which of us would you rather feed on? If you had free rein?

Astarion_Vampire_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Vampire_3.text: Ah! Wyll. No question. He's strong, fast, and righteous. I'm salivating already.

Astarion_Vampire_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Vampire_2.text: You sound disappointed. I'll bite you if you ask.

Astarion_Vampire_4.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Vampire_4.text: I'm sure you would. Don't sound so eager.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_3.text: Something has changed about our friend, hasn't it? But I can't quite put my finger on it.
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_3.context: NodeContext: Teasing, playing dumb. Referring to Astarion's romance with the player (he's turned them) appliicable to either SH arc

Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_2.text: This hungry look in their eyes... The haunted complexion... What could it mean?
Astarion_ROM_Act3_Ascendant_2.context: NodeContext: Teasing, playing dumb. Referring to Astarion's romance with the player (he's turned them) appliicable to either SH arc

Gale_BlushingMermaid_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_BlushingMermaid_0.text: Not too downmarket of an establishment for you I hope, Gale?

Gale_BlushingMermaid_3.speaker: Gale
Gale_BlushingMermaid_3.text: Not at all. Why, some of the finest artists and musicians began their careers amidst stale beer and sticky floors.

Gale_BlushingMermaid_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_BlushingMermaid_2.text: There is poetry to be found in even the dingiest of holes.

Gale_BlushingMermaid_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_BlushingMermaid_1.text: Remind me to not attend any poetry recitals with you.

Karlach_RebelHideoutMasonsGuild_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Karlach_RebelHideoutMasonsGuild_0.text: I love a nice secret hideaway, don't you?
Karlach_RebelHideoutMasonsGuild_0.context: NodeContext: Waxing lyrical (perhaps on some level unconsciously recalling her own childhood hideaway that she can find in act 3). Applicable to either SH arc path

Karlach_RebelHideoutMasonsGuild_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Karlach_RebelHideoutMasonsGuild_2.text: You can just fill it with supplies, seal up the hidden entrance, and tuck yourself away from the world...
Karlach_RebelHideoutMasonsGuild_2.context: NodeContext: Waxing lyrical (perhaps on some level unconsciously recalling her own childhood hideaway that she can find in act 3). Applicable to either SH arc path

Astarion_CountingHouse_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_CountingHouse_0.text: I don't suppose you really have much use for gold, do you, Astarion?

Astarion_CountingHouse_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_CountingHouse_3.text: It's not required, but it is nice to have. It buys any number of ways to keep life interesting.

Astarion_CountingHouse_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_CountingHouse_1.text: Go on then, coyness isn't in your nature. What would you do with unlimited funds?

Astarion_CountingHouse_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_CountingHouse_2.text: Let's just say blood tastes better from a gold goblet, and silk bedsheets improve any night-time activity.

Wyll_DevilFee_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_DevilFee_0.text: Fiend worship... I'm not trying to pick a fight, Wyll. But it really seems like a blatantly ill-advised idea.
Wyll_DevilFee_0.context: NodeContext: Butter wouldn't melt/teasing. Applicable to either SH arc

Wyll_DevilFee_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_DevilFee_3.text: It's the furthest thing from my mind. Besides, Shadowheart - not all fiends are cut from the same scorched cloth.

Wyll_DevilFee_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_DevilFee_1.text: How do they differ, then? The number of horns? The exact timbre of their evil laugh?
Wyll_DevilFee_1.context: NodeContext: Teasing. Applicable to either SH arc

Wyll_DevilFee_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_DevilFee_2.text: Could be most anything. Their willingness to torment their travel partners with wisecracks, for example.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Laezel_ROM_Act3_2.text: Baldur's Gate can be dirty, overcrowded, dangerous... but I do like it all the same. Found anything to admire in it, Lae'zel?
Laezel_ROM_Act3_2.context: NodeContext: 'I am fond of Baldur's Gate' = SH loyal to Shar. 'Baldur's Gate can be dirty' = SH turned from Shar

Laezel_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Laezel_ROM_Act3_0.text: How about you, Lae'zel? You're new to the city - found anything to admire in it?
Laezel_ROM_Act3_0.context: NodeContext: Banter with Lae'zel. Shared line applicable to eitther SH arc

Laezel_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act3_1.text: Admire it? As an overripe fruit ready for plucking, or a fattened calf awaiting the knife, perhaps.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act3_3.text: This place was constructed as if it wants a foreign power to pillage it.

Gale_ROM_Act1_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_ROM_Act1_3.text: Isn't it so, that every time you speak as you cast a spell, you're endeavouring to call upon Mystra?
Gale_ROM_Act1_3.context: NodeContext: Idle banter with Gale. Expressing curiosity about Gale's relationship with his goddess. Early game/SH is loyal to Shar

Gale_ROM_Act1_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_ROM_Act1_2.text: I'm surprised she still listens to you.
Gale_ROM_Act1_2.context: NodeContext: Idle banter with Gale. Expressing curiosity about Gale's relationship with his goddess. Early game/SH is loyal to Shar

Gale_ROM_Act1_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act1_0.text: She has no choice - she's sworn to hear all magic users. Even me.

Gale_ROM_Act1_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act1_1.text: I'm sure she at least stuffs her fingers in her ears to muffle my invocations.

Astarion_Battlefield_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Battlefield_0.text: Imagine what this place was like, on the day of the battle. The ground must have been covered with the dead...

Astarion_Battlefield_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Battlefield_3.text: A tragedy - just think of all that wasted blood.

Astarion_Battlefield_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_Battlefield_2.text: You wouldn't actually feed in the wake of a battle, would you? You're not a vulture.

Astarion_Battlefield_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Battlefield_1.text: Oh, I don't know. I've fed on things that would disgust most vultures.

Karlach_RoadToSCL_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Karlach_RoadToSCL_0.text: We've had some close calls already. There could be even tougher days ahead...
Karlach_RoadToSCL_0.context: NodeContext: Some trepidation about challenges that lie ahead. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

Karlach_RoadToSCL_3.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_RoadToSCL_3.text: Cheer up. It might be all downhill from here.

Karlach_RoadToSCL_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Karlach_RoadToSCL_1.text: Meaning things will start becoming easier for us, or our situation will deteriorate from here...?
Karlach_RoadToSCL_1.context: NodeContext: 'Are you trying to be reassurring or...?' Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

Wyll_UpperTracks_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_UpperTracks_0.text: Amazing how the city can seem almost peaceful at times, knowing all that goes on out there.

Wyll_UpperTracks_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_UpperTracks_1.text: Consider the numbers. Someone out there must be having the worst day of their life. Being robbed, evicted, widowed, who knows? Then, easy prey for Lady Shar.
Wyll_UpperTracks_1.context: NodeContext: Cynical philosophising. Slight smirk at the end, considering how things benefit her goddess. Arc: SH is loyal to shar

Wyll_UpperTracks_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_UpperTracks_2.text: If that's true, then so must be the opposite: there are people out there celebrating their lives' best moment.

Wyll_UpperTracks_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_UpperTracks_3.text: A wedding to their betrothed, a new baby, a windfall... the taste of an exquisite pudding...

Wyll_UpperTracks_5.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_UpperTracks_5.text: Consider the numbers. Someone out there must be having the worst day of their life. Robbed, evicted, widowed, who knows? No wonder Shar thrives, with such misery...
Wyll_UpperTracks_5.context: NodeContext: Cynical philosophising. Arc - SH has abandoned shar

Astarion_MountainPass_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_MountainPass_2.text: I didn't exactly dress for hiking mountains. Shame we couldn't procure some pack mules, or horses.
Astarion_MountainPass_2.context: NodeContext: Slight grumble (trekking through a mountain pass). Arc: early game/SH loyal to shar.

Astarion_MountainPass_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_MountainPass_0.text: Horses? Perish the thought - those ill-tempered beasts are prone to biting.

Astarion_MountainPass_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Astarion_MountainPass_1.text: Well, so are you, but we keep you around, don't we?
Astarion_MountainPass_1.context: NodeContext: Teasing Astarion. Arc: early game/SH loyal to shar.

Astarion_MountainPass_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_MountainPass_3.text: And I'm not offering any rides, if that's what you're thinking.

Laezel_Peace_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Laezel_Peace_3.text: So. Have we buried the hatchet, Lae'zel?

Laezel_Peace_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Peace_0.text: No. Why would I bury a weapon? Is it broken?

Laezel_Peace_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Peace_1.text: I do not know your metaphor. But if you need help digging, I will find a shovel.

Wyll_Fangirl_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_Fangirl_2.text: So Wyll, what was the Blade of Frontiers' toughest kill?

Wyll_Fangirl_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Fangirl_3.text: Ah - it was a great scrap. A hungry minotaur with a hankering for human flesh.

Wyll_Fangirl_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Fangirl_0.text: An axe-bearing mountain of fur, she was. Gave me a nasty scar.

Wyll_Fangirl_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Wyll_Fangirl_1.text: I hope you don't mind if I don't ask to see it.

Karlach_Grymforge_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Karlach_Grymforge_0.text: This place is hard to bear. I hope we're able to continue on our way before too long.
Karlach_Grymforge_0.context: NodeContext: Slightly uneasy. Early game, when SH is still loyal to Shar.

Karlach_Grymforge_4.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_Grymforge_4.text: I know what you mean. Everyone is so... unhappy.

Karlach_Grymforge_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Karlach_Grymforge_1.text: Oh. Well I meant more the molten rock and plunging chasms, but yes, the folk leave something to be desired as well.
Karlach_Grymforge_1.context: NodeContext: Early game, when SH is still loyal to Shar.

Karlach_Grymforge_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Karlach_Grymforge_2.text: Oh hush, you. Stop fishing for compliments.
Karlach_Grymforge_2.context: NodeContext: (very gently) chiding. Early game, when SH is still loyal to Shar.

Karlach_Monastery_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Karlach_Monastery_0.text: A remote spot for a monastery. I suppose they wanted to make sure the monks avoided temptation.
Karlach_Monastery_0.context: NodeContext: Considering a large ruined monastery high up in a mountain pass. Early game/still loyal to Shar.

Karlach_Monastery_4.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_Monastery_4.text: Yeah but look at these mountains. The height of temptation.

Karlach_Monastery_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Karlach_Monastery_1.text: No, I mean more like vices. You know - pleasures of the flesh.
Karlach_Monastery_1.context: NodeContext: A bit confused by Karlach's musing. Early game/still loyal to Shar.

Karlach_Monastery_3.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_Monastery_3.text: Met a loumara demon who married a mountain, though. It's a thing.

Karlach_Monastery_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Karlach_Monastery_2.text: I think the thin air might be getting to you, Karlach.
Karlach_Monastery_2.context: NodeContext: Amused laugh. Early game/still loyal to Shar.

Minthara_ROM_Act2_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Minthara_ROM_Act2_2.text: Any doubts about falling for a foe, Minthara? Or does that just add spice to things?
Minthara_ROM_Act2_2.context: NodeContext: Slightly-teasing enquiry. Alluding to Minthara being in a relationship with the player. Can be applicable to either SH arc

Minthara_ROM_Act2_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ROM_Act2_1.text: I do not fall for my foes. I vanquish them.

Minthara_ROM_Act2_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ROM_Act2_0.text: I cannot love who I do not trust, with either my heart or my body. I am fortunate to have found someone worthy.
